availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: A Kentucky farmer. Lived in Hopkins County, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Isabel Mason. Father of Samuel Hopkins, Elizabeth A. Mason, Margaret Mason, L. M. Mason, James A. Mason, and Jane Mason. Owned two enslaved persons in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 38; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 3; "Hopkins Mason," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=89301022&ref=acom) (accessed on April 11, 2017).
